body_html:
Yes, that is possible. Here's some cpuinfo (coudn't find 'avx' by grepping /proc/cpuinfo):

processor       : 0
vendor_id       : GenuineIntel
cpu family      : 6
model           : 26
model name      : Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU           W3530  @ 2.80GHz
stepping        : 5
microcode       : 0x19

additionally, this dockerfile produces the error for me:

FROM ubuntu

RUN apt update && apt install -y python3 python3-virtualenv virtualenv

RUN bash -c '\
 /usr/bin/virtualenv -p python3 testvenv && \
 source testvenv/bin/activate && \
 pip install tensorflow==1.7 && \
 echo "import tensorflow" > test.py && \
 python test.py'

body:
Yes, that is possible. Here's some cpuinfo (coudn't find 'avx' by grepping /proc/cpuinfo):
```
processor       : 0
vendor_id       : GenuineIntel
cpu family      : 6
model           : 26
model name      : Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU           W3530  @ 2.80GHz
stepping        : 5
microcode       : 0x19
```
additionally, this dockerfile produces the error for me:

```
FROM ubuntu

RUN apt update && apt install -y python3 python3-virtualenv virtualenv

RUN bash -c '\
 /usr/bin/virtualenv -p python3 testvenv && \
 source testvenv/bin/activate && \
 pip install tensorflow==1.7 && \
 echo "import tensorflow" > test.py && \
 python test.py'
```
